channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Coronavirus quickly spread around the world starting late last year, new genetic analysis shows
item.description: A new genetic analysis of the virus that causes Covid-19 taken from more than 7,600 patients around the world shows it has been circulating in people since late last year, and must have spread extremely quickly after the first infection.

item.title: UK coronavirus death toll overtakes Italy's to become highest in Europe
Reporter asks Trump: Why wind down task force now?
item.description: President Donald Trump explains why he is winding down the coronavirus task force near the end of May.

item.title: Trump officials are trying to enlist foreign allies in pressure campaign against China
item.description: With the general election just six months away, and the global economy in shambles because of the coronavirus, there is increasing urgency inside the White House and among President Donald Trump's Republican allies to blame China over its failure to stem the spread of the disease early on.

item.title: Anthony Fauci just crushed Donald Trump's theory on the origins of the coronavirus
White House coronavirus task force to be wound down around Memorial Day
item.description: The White House coronavirus task force will start to wind down later this month, a senior White House official told CNN on Tuesday.

item.title: Ousted US vaccine director files whistleblower complaint alleging virus warnings were ignored
item.description: Dr. Rick Bright, the ousted director of the office involved in developing a coronavirus vaccine, formally filed an extensive whistleblower complaint Tuesday alleging his early warnings about the coronavirus were ignored and that his caution at a treatment favored by President Donald Trump led to his removal.

item.title: See video doctor filmed before he mysteriously fell from window in Russia
item.description: Three frontline health care workers have mysteriously fallen out of hospital windows in Russia over the past two weeks, heightening public attention to the working conditions for doctors and medical professionals amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus is killing more African Americans than any other group in the US, study finds
item.description: More African Americans are dying from coronavirus in the United States than whites or other ethnic groups, according to a new study .

item.title: US states might have to shut down again, expert says
A 5-year-old boy was pulled over in Utah on his way to California to try to buy a Lamborghini
item.description: A 5-year-old boy with $3 in his pocket was pulled over by Utah police while driving his parent's car to California to buy a Lamborghini.

item.title: NASA is working with Tom Cruise to shoot a film in outer space
item.description: Tom Cruise wants fly into outer space in the name of filmmaking, and NASA says it's happening.

item.title: A man wore what appeared to be a KKK white hood on a trip to the grocery store
item.description: Masks and face coverings are recommended, even required, in many US supermarkets now.

item.title: Airbnb is laying off 25% of its employees
item.description: Airbnb is laying off about 25% of its workforce as the coronavirus pandemic upends the travel industry and threatens the company's core business.

item.title: Man wipes nose on store clerk after refusing to wear mask
item.description: A 68-year-old Michigan man has been arrested on assault charges after police say he entered a Dollar Tree and wiped his face on an employee's shirt.

item.title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg 'resting comfortably' after nonsurgical treatment for benign gallbladder condition
item.description: Ruth Bader Ginsburg underwent nonsurgical treatment for a benign gallbladder condition Tuesday afternoon at John Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore, a court spokeswoman said in a statement.

item.title: Europe and China were on course for a reset. Coronavirus changed all that
item.description: Before coronavirus brought the world to its knees, 2020 was slated to be a crucial year for the European Union and China.

item.title: UK coronavirus adviser resigns after breaking lockdown rules he helped design
item.description: A leading epidemiologist who advised the UK government on its coronavirus response resigned from his government post on Tuesday, after the Telegraph newspaper reported he broke the lockdown rules he helped shape.

item.title: United Airlines tells staff to take 20 unpaid days off before October and will lay off 30% of them
item.description: United has warned some of its staff that the airline will sharply reduce hours and staffing in the months to come.

item.title: Park ranger was telling a crowd to social distance. Mid-speech, someone pushed him into a lake
item.description: A man accused of shoving an Austin, Texas, park ranger into the water while the ranger was explaining to a crowd the need for social distancing is embarrassed by his actions, his lawyer said.

item.title: See how wearing a mask affects how a cough travels
item.description: A lab at Florida Atlantic University is simulating a human cough to understand how far and fast cough droplets can spread.

item.title: This airline is losing $1 million an hour
Barr urges Trump administration to back off call to fully strike down Obamacare
item.description: Attorney General William Barr made a last-minute push Monday to persuade the administration to modify its position in the Obamacare dispute that will be heard at the Supreme Court this fall, arguing that the administration should pull back from its insistence that the entire law be struck down.

item.title: Italians reunited with pizza as lockdown eases
item.description: The pizzerias of Naples, Italy, are back in business now that Italy has eased its lockdown. It's a small step back to normality for this city's residents. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

item.title: Venezuela claims to have captured two Americans involved in failed invasion
item.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro says two American "mercenaries" have been apprehended after a failed coup attempt launched over the weekend.

item.title: TikTok is winning over millennials and Instagram stars as its popularity explodes
item.description: Alana Tsui hadn't really thought about joining TikTok before the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Want a Greek vacation this summer? You might get one
item.description: Greece avoided the first Covid-19 wave with an early lockdown. Now the prime minister wants to welcome tourists. Will it work? Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: For the first time, scientists can see how the brain records our memories as we sleep
item.description: Tiny electrodes buried in the brains of paralized people allow a fascinating look at how the brain replays our memories during sleep for long term storage.

item.title: Two weeks of zero local infections: How Hong Kong contained its second wave of Covid-19
Protesters recreate 'coffin dance' meme
item.description: Inspired by the popular Ghanaian "coffin dance" meme, demonstrators took to the streets after the Lebanese lira lost more than half its value in recent weeks.

item.title: State-backed hackers behind wave of cyberattacks targeting coronavirus response, US and UK warn
item.description: The United States and United Kingdom issued a new advisory Tuesday warning of ongoing cyberattacks against organizations involved in the coronavirus response, including health care bodies, pharmaceutical companies, academics, medical research organizations and local government.

item.title: 'So what?': Amanpour is shocked by Brazilian president's reaction
item.description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour discusses the concerns that surround Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's handling of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Elon Musk and Grimes welcome a baby boy
The plane that's become a Covid-19 hero
item.description: During the week of April 21, there were just two passenger-carrying 747 jumbo jets flying around the world. The Covid-19 pandemic has made the Queen of the Skies an acutely endangered monarch.

item.title: Qantas plans for London-Sydney nonstop flights suspended by coronavirus
item.description: At a time when traveling more than two kilometers is a pipe dream beyond the reach of millions, it's not surprising the mood isn't right to press on with plans for a 19-hour nonstop flight service between London and Sydney.

item.title: Watch Daniel Radcliffe read 'Harry Potter'
item.description: Daniel Radcliffe and other celebrities are taking turns reading chapters of the "Harry Potter" book series, as part of J.K. Rowling's new online reading hub.

item.title: Judi Dench, 85, becomes British Vogue's oldest cover star
item.description: Oscar-winning actor Judi Dench has become the oldest person ever to feature on the cover of British Vogue at the age of 85.

item.title: The Michael Jordan documentary is creating a bull market for his sneakers
item.description: If stocks have taken a pounding over the last few weeks, there has been a bull market raging in Nike's range of Michael Jordan sneakers.

item.title: #MetGalaChallenge has people recreating iconic looks
item.description: Since the Met Gala was canceled this year, Billy Porter and Vogue created the #MetGalaChallenge that has people creating iconic looks from past years in their home.

item.title: What I learned from 9 road trips across America
item.description: My American road trips are a highlight reel of memorable scenes, random lessons learned, and a perpetual, soul-fulfilling desire to go back and forth, again and again.

item.title: Pandemic offers 'opportunity for F1 to change,' says Nico Hulkenberg
item.description: Nine-year Formula 1 veteran Nico Hulkenberg believes the enforced break the sport is having to undergo because of the coronavirus pandemic offers the perfect time to make some changes.

item.title: Dutch Master Vermeer's guide to counting the hours
item.description: The Dutch painter Jan Vermeer was no stranger to the kind of socially isolated world we now find ourselves in. His hometown of Delft was stricken with plague several times in the artist's lifetime. In 1635 and 1636 over 2,000 people died, and in the mid-1650s and mid-1660s hundreds more.

item.title: Hear from astronaut on returning to earth amid pandemic
item.description: NASA astronaut Jessica Meir just returned to Earth to find a world now transformed by the coronavirus. Meir shares details about how she is transitioning into a new normal.

item.title: Fauci just crushed Trump's theory on virus origin
item.description: For weeks now, President Donald Trump has been making the case that the coronavirus originated not in nature but in a lab in Wuhan, China. He said late last week that he had a "high degree of confidence" that was what happened (although he didn't specify why he felt that way) and on Sunday night in a Fox town hall offered cryptically "something happened."

item.title: South Korea sees lowest case numbers in 78 days
Wait, Donald Trump's approval is up again?
item.description: The narrative seemed set: After a brief surge of public support for President Donald Trump in the early days of America's fight against the coronavirus, his approval numbers had settled back into the low 40s.

item.title: The bankruptcy wave is here
Billions of people could live in areas too hot for humans by 2070, study says
Leading global airline losing $1 million an hour and needs bailout
item.description: Lufthansa is locked in crunch talks with the German government on the terms of a rescue deal, as it fights to avoid bankruptcy while keeping state influence at bay.

item.title: UK now has the highest death toll in Europe
item.description: Analysis: Europe and China were on course for a reset. Coronavirus changed all that
